result.execSummary:
The defendant Ahman R Neal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying A Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Complete an online firearms safety class.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

No firearms or dangerous weapons.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Court ordered matter Expunged upon successful completion of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ahman R Neal

records.addlTxt: Correction to the 10/14/22 sentencing:  COURT ORDERED MATTER EXPUNGED UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ahman R Neal in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Ahman R Neal.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:

- Complete 20 hours of community service.
- Complete an on-line firearms safety class.
- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.  rmm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.  rmm

Defendant Ahman R Neal in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Ahman R Neal.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Fuentes requests a plea and sentencing date.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Motion Hearing exhibits from 8/5/2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: BOX 789.

Defendant Ahman R Neal in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion to suppress held.  Sworn for the state:  Wauwatosa Police Officers Keiagane Mork-Cardon and Aaron Radwill.  Exhibit #'s 1& 2 received.  Parties rest.  Argument heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies the motion.  Atty. Fuentes requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress , filed.  rmm
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence Obtained During Unlawful Stop, filed.  rmm

Defendant Ahman R Neal in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Fuentes requests a briefing schedule and a motion hearing date.  Court ordered defense to file the motion and brief with the court no later than 6/20/22; state to file response no later than 7/20/22.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with B.C.H.Jr. (d.o.b. 5/7/11)
D.D.S.(d.o.b. 8/29/09)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ahman R Neal in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Ahman R Neal in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ahman R Neal appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
